bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Pablo Isaac Garcia, December 30, 1941

div1.p: Hench thanks Garcia for a photograph of Hospital No. 1. He is looking forward to receiving a copy of "Memorias del Hospital Numero Uno."

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Pablo Isaac Garcia, December 30, 1941
div1.opener:
Y F.
Copy to Dr. Rodriguez - Perez
Fileunder A
December 30, 1941
Senor Pablo Isaac Garcia
The Alabama Photo Studios
Obispo No. 314
Entre Habana y Aguiar
Habana, Cuba
My dear Senor Garcia:
div1.p:
I have your letter of December 19 referring to the order given to
you in my letter of November 21, asking for a copy of “Memorias del Hospital
Numero Uno”. I have received the photograph of the hospital and I am de-
lighted to have it.

I am indeed pleased and surprised to hear from you that apparently
Dr. Perez is going to send me with the compliments of the Finlay Institute
a photostatic copy of the remainder of the book. I received a letter from
him a few days ago saying that the book was in your hands and that he was
having a copy of it made to send to the Surgeon General's library in Wash-
ington. Perhaps at that time he had an extra copy made for me. I certainly
appreciate this. If, however, you are mistaken, and he did not have a copy
made for me please go ahead and complete my order. Otherwise, return the
remainder of the check to me.

In any event, would it be possible for you to get at this at once
so that I might have a copy in my hands here before January 8? I am going
to Washington and would like very much to have it with me when I go. If you
find that you cannot get it to this Rochester address by January 8, you could
send it to me at the Willard Hotel, Washington, D. C., to be held for my
arrival there on January 13. I am taking the liberty of sending Dr. Perez
a copy of this letter.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
